title: For a game that is ruined it seems like Riot has done a good job making people want to keep playing
body: Nothing but complaints on boards about how the game is dead and how you hate the game, but then I check your profile and many of you still play it just as much as someone who enjoys the game.  You'd think that people who complain and complain nonstop about how a game is dead or awful would stop playing, but I guess not.

replies.body: Video game addiction is a real thing

Many who complain don't want the game to die, don't want the game to be in the state it is and want it to be amazing. Because they don't want to quit and want to play a game more akin to when they started. The game they fell in love with

No I left because Ghostcrawler joined the dev team and I saw the writting on the wall.  I re-installed after years away just because I knew I'd have a week or 2 where I had to burn some time, just to see how things went.  With Atlas Reactor dead (a good game that actually required skill), I needed something else to play.

I was right.  The game is an utter sht show compared to S3/S4.  There's zero counter play, carries with just 3-4 kills ahead are running around deleteing people.  I've seen 1... 1 single game where the team ahead by 5 kills didn't win since re-installing.  That's nearly 100 games or so and 1 made a 'come-back'.

The level of gameplay is abysmal.  People can't land skill shots, can't dodge them, there's zero communication, zero teamwork.  You don't see stacking of abilities, or coordination, just 100 fed Yasuos running around 4v1ing everyone; because why not when you're playing god-mode.

I watch a 4.4k Mundo die in less than 3 frames, a Graves 100-0 a Rammus in less than 0.5s, a Kayne 5v1 and take out 4 people.  Pykes diving towers at level 2 (and easily surviving), Akali's that are basically uncounterable.  The whole thing is this fcked up mess of unbelievably unbalanced proportions.

And then we get to e-sports.  A game with zero strategy, technical prowess, or tactics is supposedly 'esport' worthy?  The whole point of DOTA and transitively league was to cater to poor players who couldn't handle 3 heros and an army, and needed and AI to handle most of it for them.  Its like watching race walking in the Olympics... sure there's a winner but who cares?

Every game was the same champs in the same positions, using the same items and the same strategy.  To differ even remotely from the meta was insta-loss on either side.  Strategy and tactics??  Are you kidding me?  90% of the champions aren't even used.  But don't worry, you'll see a Zed in every 2nd game...

Then we get to the wonderfully toxic community, where unless you're a carry everything is your fault.  Want to play support or jungle, be prepared for EVERYTHING to be your fault.  What fun it is to be blamed for everyone's failure.  Do well as support and you're 'stealing kills' from the idiot ADC that can't dodge a skill shot to save his life.  Best of all, even when you do amazing in support, it has no meaningful outcome on the game, you're not a carry so you don't matter.  You won't get honor, no one will care, but the 12/9 yi that managed to find his Q while everyone was stunned, he'll get the honor, the kills, the items, and all the goodies.  And they wonder why no one wants to play support.  Have you even actually tried to /fill, every single game is support or jungle.  Not once did I get anything else.  I think the most memorable part was knowing that every single carry can insta-kill you with zero chance of escape or counter-play, no matter how bad or low hp they are, 1v1.  You can't even run with a well played CC, every carry now has multiple closers and nearly every dmg item having movement speed.  Unless your flash is up, you're dead.  Even if you land every skill shot/CC perfectly, they'll still just walk up, right click and you get delete'd, have fun warding!!!  Its your job to ward but to move more than inches away from your team and your insta-dead!!! OH WHAT FUN!!!  I mean really, who thought that the least mobile and squishiest champs in the game, the ones with the least cash and least escape options, they should be the ones wandering around trying to drop wards in dangerous spots...

I know its all just a cash grab... I just don't understand... do people really not see how bad it is?  If I were to teach a course on game design I'd use LOL as the quintessential example of what not to do.  And then on top of all that we have Gameplay and Gameplay+ forums on the boards?  Are you kidding me?  Like that's a joke right?  I hate to bring up Godwin's law, but it'd be like the Nazi's having a "compassion, caring, and empathy for other's" forum.

The only reason I've played it even for the last 2 weeks at all is simply out of pure morbid curiosity.  I am completely baffled how anyone can find anything good to say about it, or find any enjoyment in it.  I'm far more curious as to why people are playing it than any 'entertainment' value it might have to offer.  And honestly for the life of me cannot understand why.  This ranks up there with The Kardashians, Jerry Springer, Reality TV, Flappy Bird, and the Transformers movies; in the list of things I just truly do not understand why they even exist let alone are successful.

I'm certain this will get downvoted, then delete'd, and my account banned.  I don't really care.  I'm not angry, really I'm not, and I don't care about winning or losing games.  I'm just completely and utterly baffled.

Yeah, like I said: Nostalgia goggles on way too tight. Can't reason with it.

"Oh everything's worse because everything's worse." What do you expect anyone to say to you when you're so stuck in this mindset? You should head back to Atlas Reactor.

"You should head back to Atlas Reactor." - Oh I wish I could.  I won so many games with a well timed Rampart ult or grip.  Countering a Pup or Kaigan ult was pure bliss.  You should try it... but it is brutal on beginners.  No snowball, no RNG, all strategy.
You say that like any other competitive game doesn't require proper timing and utilization of tools. And if the game's dead, it probably isn't nearly as good as you're hyping it to be.

RIOT is a terrible company and Im happy to never give them money and leech for free.

First, Riot uses tactics to keep people addicted, so it's not fair to blame players for sticking with something they don't like anymore. Second, if you think Boards are nothing but complaints, you must be putting a lot of effort into avoiding the avalanche of posts about Worlds and the Popstar 2.0 skin line. That's why the first group of people is complaining, by the way: bugs and balance issues abound, but the second group of people doesn't care about that and just eats up competitive play, music videos, and so on.

Have you noticed that "balance is garbo but I love the game's Story, Art, & Sound" has gotten a lot of traction in the last few months? Riot is focusing on the things that make them money: skins and pro play. Riot doesn't sell bug and balance fixes for RP (in fact, they do the opposite - new champs and skins generally get buffs for a while), so it's tough to justify spending resources on that. Unfortunately, this logic isn't sustainable in the long term, as even the most vapid "CAN K/DA GET MOAR FX PLZ?" players will get annoyed by the game's actual gameplay and possibly quit, while the players who are here to actually play would only buy the occasional skin when they're having fun with the game. Given the "To Sell Toys" nature of LoL (also known as "merchandising"), a solid base product is core to the business model. People are quitting, and thigh-high skins aren't keeping them here no matter how much the cosmetics crowd loves them.

If you've heard of Rift, you'll be familiar with what happens when gameplay is abandoned in favor of things that actually show up on the quarterly balance sheet. The game has had no new content for a full year, with pretty much all development effort going into cosmetics for the cash shop. Some people love that stuff, and they buy it, which stands in stark contrast to dungeons and raids that are available to all with no cash outlay, but the population has all but disappeared, which hurt sales for pretty much everything. Raiders might not have spammed threads about how cool the newest mount was, but they occasionally bought things. Now the company has been sold to avoid bankruptcy due to massive debt, all the devs were laid off, and all the titles are now owned by a publisher that specializes in maintenance mode.

P.S.: Riot is having its worst year since 2014 and YoY revenue is down 21%, and that's _with_ the increasing quality (judging by the fanboy praise) of the game's cosmetic items.

P.P.S.: My LoL play since the Odyssey debacle consists of a few matches every couple weeks on my main when I'm tilted by life and feel like losing in PvP. I used to play half a dozen matches a day.
